name: Delta Force: Black Hawk Down
description: In late 1993, the United States launched dual military operations in Mogadishu Somalia. Delta Force Operatives and Army Rangers were sent in to capture Somali warlords and restore order. Experience the intense combat of Operation Restore Hope in this ground breaking first person shooter.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 2000, XP & Vista Processor: Pentium III 733MHz or better Memory: 256MB minimum Graphics: Direct3D with 32MB or better DirectXÂ®: DirectX version 8.1 or higher (included) Hard Drive: 860MB Free Sound: DirectX-compliant

reviews.review_text: The game is a legend, and a great classic!

Love this game, even ten years later!   I could go into huge detail on why I think you should get this game. But what would be the point? You will either get it or you wont. But all I can tell you is that this is an amazing shooter. And rather difficult too!

It's a bit of a departure from the earlier Delta Force games, it replaces the long range missions from 1 and 2 for tight urban fights, to keep with the theme of the actual events, I guess.  This game is decent enough that I played through the campaign, but if you want some classic DF gameplay then go play Arma 2 or 3.
Great old classic FPS. Challenging single player and huge multiplayer maps
Truly one of the best games, hands down, from my childhood. I remember playing this game inside circuit city when that store was still around XD good times.

It may have been good in 2011, but now, I just don't like it. It isn't fun, not like a good arcade shooter. Not worth 15$, I got shot from over 300 Meters away with an AK in the leg, and it killed me instantly, the ballistics are non-existant, and is just not a good overall game, unless you like hardcore games that are arcade shooters, then buy it.
